page.title: 18Mum's Schooldays In Wendover
page.content: My mum's childhood in the early 1950's was not like mine because her parents were very strict. On Saturday morning she went with friends to the children's cinema in Aylesbury, but today I watch T.V at home. My mum went to church three times on Sunday but does not expect me to. The games she played were similar to my own, marbles, skipping, conkers, 5 stones, hopscotch and leapfrog. She also had fun roller-skating up the High Street and went on long cycle rides. Traffic prevents that kind of activity today. Mum's pocket money was 2/6d (12p) but mine is 1 pound. When she was 10 years old, Mum was crowned May Queen - the last one the village had. What a pity many of these customs have disappeared.
